174.title: Russia's war is based on lies: German Foreign Minister Baerbock
174.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Tuesday called on UN member states to strongly condemn Russia's invasion of Ukraine, adding, "Russia's war is one of aggression and it is based on lies." Baerbock spoke at an emergency meeting of the UN General Assembly. Baerbock accused Russia of abusing its power as a permanent member of the UN Security Council.

175.title: Eastern Ukraine cities remain areas of concern: Govt on stranded Indians
175.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs while talking about the evacuation process of Indians from Ukraine said the cities in eastern Ukraine remain areas of concern. "Some students were able to board trains out of Kharkiv [Tuesday] night and [Wednesday] morning," MEA Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said. The Indian embassy in Ukraine has asked Indians in Kharkiv to leave the city immediately.

176.title: Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Prithviraj' to release on June 3
176.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actor Akshay Kumar announced that his upcoming film 'Prithviraj' will release on June 3. "Elated to announce that Samrat Prithviraj Chauhan's grand saga is arriving sooner on the big screen," Akshay wrote. The film was slated to release on June 10. 'Prithviraj' also features former Miss World Manushi Chhillar and actor Sanjay Dutt.

177.title: Why weren't the students stuck in Ukraine evacuated earlier: Mamata
177.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday asked why Indian students were not brought back from Ukraine earlier when the Central government became aware of the developments. "Somebody died. Some people are moving from here and there. Somebody is waiting in bunkers, somebody is waiting in Romania, somebody is not getting food," she further said.

178.title: Govt prepared a draft for women's empowerment policy: Maha Minister
178.article_body: Maharashtra Minister for Women and Child Development Yashomati Thakur has said that the state government has prepared a draft for the new women's empowerment policy that takes a holistic view of gender equality. "The policy focuses on the social and economic development of women and persons belonging to the LGBTQIA lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans, queer, intersex, asexual community," Thakur said.

179.title: Israel, Germany call for an increase in Russia-Ukraine peace talks
179.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett on Wednesday called for increased peace talks between Russia and Ukraine. "I'm very thankful that both of us are going to do what we can to make sure that talks between Ukraine and Russia will soon be continued," Scholz said on his first tour to Israel as German chancellor.

180.title: Requirement to wear masks indoors at Pentagon dropped by US military
180.article_body: The US military on Wednesday said it is dropping indoor mask requirements for 20,000 military and civilian employees at the Pentagon, after the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) updated its COVID-19 guidelines. The decision follows the White House telling federal agencies on Monday that they can remove mask mandates for visitors and employees in US federal buildings.

181.title: Russian, Belarusian athletes to compete as neutrals at Paralympics
181.article_body: The International Paralympic Committee (IPC) on Wednesday said Russian and Belarusian athletes can compete as neutrals in the upcoming Winter Paralympics in Beijing. "They will compete under the Paralympic flag and not be included in the medal table," the IPC said. The IPC added they will not host any events in Russia or Belarus until further notice.

182.title: Woman kills 34-yr-old husband over domestic dispute in Rajasthan
182.article_body: A woman allegedly strangled her 34-year-old husband to death in the Barmer district of Rajasthan, police said on Wednesday. According to the police, the couple was addicted to alcohol and had a dispute on Tuesday evening. The Station House Officer (SHO) of Kotwali Police Station, Ugamraj Soni, said that the accused was unhappy with her husband's low income.

183.title: Shibani Dandekar dismisses pregnancy rumours, says 'It was tequila'
183.article_body: Actress Shibani Dandekar put an end to the rumours that suggested she was pregnant. Taking to Instagram Stories, Shibani posted a photo of herself and wrote, "I am nottttt pregnant! It was the tequila." Rumours began after users speculated the reason behind Shibani's bloated stomach in the comment section of her wedding photo with her husband Farhan Akhtar.

184.title: 4 IAF's C-17s to bring back 800 Indians from Ukraine in next 12 hrs
184.article_body: India on Wednesday sent four C-17 military transport aircraft to Romania, Poland and Hungary to evacuate Indian students from Ukraine, officials said. The first IAF aircraft from Romania is likely to land at Hindon airbase at 1.30 am, officials added. Three more aircraft will return by 8 am on Thursday. The four aircraft will bring back about 800 Indian evacuees.

185.title: 8-yr-old practising acrobatics in room accidentally hangs self with ribbons in Argentina
185.article_body: An eight-year-old girl died in Argentina allegedly after accidentally hanging herself while practising acrobatics with fabric ribbons in her bedroom. Her parents reportedly found her hanging from the fabric and tried to revive her. "It is not goodbye, it is see you soon Laylita. We are going to miss you a lot, Princess," her family wrote on social media.

186.title: 25-yr-old woman from Punjab dies after being hit with rod in Canada
186.article_body: A 25-year-old woman from Punjab's Kapurthala died on Wednesday after she was allegedly hit on the head with a rod by a Canadian national last week. The woman, who had gone to Canada on a study visa six years ago, was currently working as a private security guard. A man known to the family confirmed her death.

187.title: Man rapes 45-year-old co-worker in Bhopal factory, arrested
187.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was allegedly raped by her co-worker in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh. The incident took place on February 24 when the victim, who works at a bottle cleaning plant in the city, was alone in the factory. Police have now arrested the accused, who also allegedly threatened the victim with dire consequences if she reported the matter to others.

188.title: SEBI didn't dilute orders on NSE matter, acted as per remit: Ex-SEBI Chief
188.article_body: Former SEBI Chairman Ajay Tyagi on Wednesday said the regulator didn't "dilute" its orders on the National Stock Exchange issue, and that it "came out with orders within [SEBI's] remit and understanding". This comes days after Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government was analysing if SEBI took "necessary punitive" action in the matter. SEBI's working is transparent, Tyagi added.

189.title: Scindia takes injured girl to seat in evacuation flight; video shows her asking for selfie
189.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia taking an Indian girl who was stranded in Ukraine to front row of the evacuation flight and asking fellow passengers to take care of her. She had a ligament tear and reportedly was stuck in Bucharest. The video also shows the girl requesting Scindia for a selfie with her.

190.title: Was asked to step down from projects due to pregnancy: Neha Dhupia
190.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia revealed that she was asked to step down from projects due to her pregnancy. "You're like 'okay, maybe it's not the requirement of the role'...and you just got to wait and you part ways amicably," she added. Referring to Kareena Kapoor Khan shooting for 'Laal Singh Chaddha' during her pregnancy, Neha said, "I really respect her."

191.title: Putin's Russia has already committed war crimes in Ukraine: UK PM
191.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin's regime has already committed war crimes in Ukraine. He said, "What we've seen already from...Putin's regime, in the use of the munitions that they've already been dropping on innocent civilians, in my view already fully qualifies as a war crime." Johnson, however, added, "With...heroism of Ukraine's people...Putin will fail."

192.title: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's 'Ponniyin Selvan-1' to release on Sept 30
192.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's 'Ponniyin Selvan-1' will receive a theatrical release on September 30. The film is directed by Mani Ratnam. It will also feature Vikram, Jayam Ravi and Sobhita Dhulipala. The film is an adaptation of Kalki Krishnamurthy's novel 'Ponniyin Selvan'. The film is jointly produced by Lyca Productions and Madras Talkies.

193.title: India trying to increase its footprint in international gaming sector: PM Modi
193.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the gaming sector "is huge internationally" and India is trying to increase its footprint in it. "The number of youth connected to this market globally is increasing. That's why...we have focused on Animation Visual Effects Gaming Comic [in Budget 2022]," PM Modi said. "For us, technology is mainstay of making the country self-reliant," he added.

194.title: MLC elections in Bihar on April 4, counting of votes on April 7
194.article_body: The Election Commission of India (ECI) on Wednesday announced that biennial elections to 24 Legislative Council (MLC) seats in Bihar will be held on April 4. The candidates will be able to file their nominations till March 16 and the last date to withdraw one's candidature is March 21. Counting of votes will be held on April 7.

195.title: Aamir said show 'Pathaan' first: SRK on whether he watched 'Laal Singh...'
195.article_body: During the #AskSRK session, a Twitter user asked actor Shah Rukh Khan if he had watched actor Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. To this, Shah Rukh replied, "Arre yaar Aamir kehta hai pehle Pathaan dikha (Aamir said show 'Pathaan' first)!" 'Pathaan' also features John Abraham and Deepika Padukone. The film will release on January 25, 2023.

196.title: Hunger will kill people for sure if Russia doesn't: Ukrainian man
196.article_body: A resident of Ukraine's Kherson city, which is claimed to have been taken by Russian troops, said he's terrified and "has no hope". The man said, "I don't know if...Russians will kill us or not, but hunger will kill people here for sure." "I just hope...Russian President Vladimir Putin will think of civilians as humans for one time," he added.

197.title: Pic shows captured Russian soldier crying while saying 'I love you' to mother on phone
197.article_body: Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) has shared a picture of a captured Russian soldier who can be seen crying while talking on phone. SBU also shared the soldier's video, wherein he could be seen breaking down in tears while telling his mother "I love you too" over the phone. "They sent us to death, everyone killed everyone," he reportedly said.

198.title: Which major US & European companies have taken action against Russia?
198.article_body: British oil companies BP and Shell announced their exit from Russia following its invasion of Ukraine. Europe's Airbus and America's ExxonMobil and Boeing, have cut ties with Russia, while Harley-Davidson and General Motors suspended vehicle exports to Russia. Apple and Dell halted all product sales in Russia, and Apple said, "We are deeply concerned about the Russian invasion of Ukraine."

199.title: 21-yr-old Indian & girlfriend escape from Ukraine, say 'For 2 days we were on road'
199.article_body: Indians Harsh Panwar, 21, and his girlfriend Reva Shrivastava, 19, who met while studying medicine at a university in Ukraine, recently escaped the country. "It was...like crossing...border from cruelty to hospitality...For two days we were on the road without any shelter," said Shrivastava. From the Romanian border, they joined a group of students driven to villages near Bucharest's main airport.

200.title: Pujara, Rahane, Pandya get demoted in BCCI central contracts list
200.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara, Ajinkya Rahane and Hardik Pandya have been downgraded in latest central contracts list of BCCI that was ratified by the board's apex council on Wednesday. Pujara and Rahane, who were in Grade A (₹5 crore) are now in Grade B (₹3 crore). Pandya, who was in Grade A (₹5 crore), has been demoted to Grade C (₹1 crore).

201.title: No one will forgive Russia for killing peaceful people: Ukraine Prez
201.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has released a social media video, wherein he slammed Russia for killing "peaceful Ukrainian people". Zelensky said, "Russian forces brutally fired on Kharkiv from jet artillery. It was clearly a war crime. There will be an international tribunal." "No one in the world will forgive you [Russia] for killing peaceful Ukrainian people," he added.

202.title: Not true: NCB on reports claiming no evidence against Aryan in drugs case
202.article_body: Sanjay Singh, the Deputy Director General of the NCB, has refuted media reports that claimed there was no evidence against Aryan Khan in the Mumbai cruise drugs case. "These are not true...just speculations," Sanjay stated. He added, "Investigation is not yet complete...it's premature to say anything at this stage." Sanjay is chief of the Special Investigation Team on the case.

203.title: PM Modi chairs 5th high-level meeting on Russia-Ukraine war
203.article_body: PM Narendra Modi chaired the fifth high-level meeting on the Russia-Ukraine war at 8:30 pm on Wednesday, soon after the Indian Embassy in Ukraine asked nationals to leave Kharkiv immediately. Earlier, PM said, "We're working round the clock to bring back all Indian nationals who are stranded in the warzone." He said the government understands the hardships students are facing.

204.title: 2 Ukrainian footballers aged 21 and 25 killed amid war with Russia
204.article_body: FIFPRO, the global footballers' union, announced that two Ukrainian footballers, 21-year-old Vitalii Sapylo and 25-year-old Dmytro Martynenko, have been killed in Kyiv amid Ukraine-Russia war. Sapylo is said to have died in Kyiv last Friday after joining the army as a tank commander, while Martynenko was reportedly killed after Russian bombs hit his home in an apartment block.

205.title: Maha reports no COVID-related death for 1st time since April 2020
205.article_body: For the first time since April 1, 2020, Maharashtra reported no coronavirus-related death on Wednesday. As per the bulletin, 544 new COVID-19 cases were reported in Maharashtra today while 1,007 patients were discharged. Further, 38 cases of the new coronavirus variant Omicron were also reported. Notably, Maharashtra's capital Mumbai logged no COVID-related death for the sixth straight day.

206.title: Malta suspends sale of its passports to Russians & Belarusians
206.article_body: Malta on Wednesday stopped sale of its passports to Russians and Belarusians, citing lack of necessary checks on prospective citizenship buyers from these two countries amid Russia-Ukraine war. Malta has been selling its passports since 2014 as part of a 'citizenship by investment' scheme. It allows foreigners to acquire Maltese citizenship by investing a minimum of €600,000 in the country.

207.title: Scindia speaks in Marathi with Indian student in Romania, video surfaces
207.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia interacted with Indian students waiting for their flights in Romania's Bucharest. In a video retweeted by him on Twitter, Scindia can be heard speaking Marathi with a student. He asked the student his name and where he was from. When he replied that he was from Maharashtra, Scindia asked him to speak in Marathi.

208.title: Indian students were kicked, dragged by Ukrainian officials: UP student after returning
208.article_body: Uttar Pradesh-based student Anshika, who returned from Ukraine on Tuesday, said Indian students were kicked and dragged by Ukrainian officials near Romanian border. "Someone pushed the students [while crossing the border], injuring a girl. Romanian army even fired in air. After this, the Ukraine officials kicked the Indian students who had fallen down and they were also dragged," she added.

209.title: New sanctions against Belarus over Ukraine invasion approved by EU
209.article_body: The French Presidency of the EU on Wednesday said the EU has approved new sanctions against Belarus for its role in supporting Russia's invasion of Ukraine. EU officials said one of the aims of the new sanctions was to stop exports of Belarusian goods to the EU. The sanctions are aimed at economic sectors like steel, timber and potash.

210.title: Who is India-born Abhay Kumar Singh, Putin's legislator who justified Russia's invasion?
210.article_body: Abhay Kumar Singh is a deputat, a post similar to an MLA in India, from Kursk, a Western Russian city. He started his business in Kursk and later joined politics. Hailing from Patna in Bihar, Singh reportedly went to Russia in 1991 to study medicine. He joined Putin's United Russia Party in 2015 and won a provincial election in 2018.

211.title: I won't wish this to even an enemy: 20-yr-old Indian who returned from Ukraine
211.article_body: Yash Pal, a 20-year-old medical student from Thane who studies in Ukraine, on his return to India, said, "I went through hell in those five days. I heard blasts, firing and saw people bleeding and running." He added, "I won't wish anything like this to even an enemy." Yash made a 600 km journey from Kyiv to the Romanian border.

212.title: Putin 'knows no limit' to how much violence Russia will use in Ukraine: UK
212.article_body: UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace on Wednesday said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "seems to know no limit to how much violence they will use in Ukraine". Wallace warned that Russia will "carpet-bomb, slowly surround and bombard" the cities of Ukraine in an act of "brutality". Notably, the Russian invasion of Ukraine entered its seventh day on Wednesday.

213.title: Sweden to send medical supplies to Ukraine amid Russian invasion
213.article_body: Sweden will send a "large amount" of medical supplies to Ukraine amid the Russian invasion, Swedish Health Minister Lena Hallengren said on Wednesday. The transfer of aid comes upon request from EU and will include one million face masks, bandages and disinfectants, along with other advanced equipment such as ventilators. Sweden closed its airspace to Russian planes on Monday.

214.title: Video shows farmers capturing & burning ₹114-crore Russian missile system in Ukraine
214.article_body: A video showing farmers burning a ₹114-crore Russian missile system in a Ukrainian field has surfaced online. Ukrainian mayor Borys Filatov claimed that farmers seized and destroyed the vehicle, adding that Russian soldiers were forced to run across the "Ukrainian fields like rats". "War is terrible grief, but these people (farmers) cannot be defeated," Filatov said.

215.title: Will free captive Russian soldiers whose mothers come to collect them: Ukraine
215.article_body: Ukraine on Wednesday announced that it would free any Russian prisoners whose mothers come to collect them in Ukraine's Kiev. "You need to call the phone number indicated in the flyer to find out if your son is captive or dead," Ukraine's Ministry of Defence said. The Ministry also shared a detailed path for the mothers to reach Kiev.

216.title: Akhilesh doesn't have strength to stop BJP from winning in UP: Owaisi
216.article_body: AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi said on Tuesday that Samajwadi Party (SP) supremo Akhilesh Yadav doesn't have "strength" to stop BJP from coming to power in UP. Owaisi added that despite SP's alliances with Congress and Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) in 2017 and 2019, it couldn't stop BJP from forming government. "Only Bhagidari Sankalp Morcha...can help UP get rid of...BJP,” he added.

217.title: Beyond silly: Manish Tewari on ministers greeting Ukraine returnees
217.article_body: Former Union Minister and Congress leader Manish Tewari on Wednesday criticised Union Ministers who have been greeting students rescued from war-hit Ukraine. "Young Indian students who barely escaped with the skin of their teeth...are being subjected to sanctimonious homilies by these ministers...in order to do their own political public relations and propaganda is beyond silly," he said.

218.title: Theatres, restaurants to function at 100% capacity in Mumbai & 13 other Maha districts
218.article_body: Amid declining COVID-19 cases, the Maharashtra government eased restrictions and allowed theatres, restaurants, bars, shopping complexes, gyms, swimming pools, tourist places and entertainment parks to function at 100% capacity in 14 districts including Mumbai and Pune. These 14 districts are the ones where over 90% have received first dose of COVID-19 vaccine and over 70% have got both doses.

219.title: Nearly 17,000 Indians have left Ukraine borders so far: Govt
219.article_body: Nearly 17,000 Indians have left Ukraine borders since India issued advisories in the last week of January, Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said on Wednesday. He informed that so far, six evacuation flights from Ukraine have landed in India and 15 flights are scheduled in the next 24 hours. A flight from Bucharest will land in Delhi tonight.

220.title: Pic shows young girl crying as she leaves behind her father fighting for Ukraine
220.article_body: An image shows a young girl crying at the border with Poland after leaving behind her father who's fighting in Ukraine amid Russia's invasion. She has a yellow rucksack with a few belongings as her family escaped the bombings and headed for the border with Poland. Male citizens of Ukraine aged 18 to 60 are prohibited from leaving the country.

221.title: Always knew 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' is an Alia Bhatt film: Shantanu
221.article_body: Actor Shantanu Maheshwari said that he knew that 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' is an Alia Bhatt film from the beginning. "However, I also knew that I have an important part in the film...I had complete belief in myself," he added. Shantanu further said that Alia doesn't carry an aura of a star and added, "She is very cooperative and a team player."

222.title: Actress Joey King gets engaged to boyfriend Steven Piet, shares pics
222.article_body: Actress Joey King announced her engagement to boyfriend and director Steven Piet. Joey took to Instagram and shared the pictures from the proposal. "Date was 2/2/22 when you asked me to marry you and made me the luckiest lady alive," she captioned the post. "Hanging out with you forever sounds like a real dream, so let's do it," she added.

223.title: Ukrainian policeman's family 'killed by Russian troops' while he was on patrol
223.article_body: A Ukrainian policeman's entire family, including his six-year-old daughter and six-week-old son, was reportedly shot dead by Russian soldiers. The policeman was out on patrol when his family was attacked. His brother, who was reportedly talking to their mother at the time of the incident, said, "I kept hearing my mother yelling that there were children...And then I heard shots."

224.title: Director Reeves misses 'The Batman' premiere after contracting COVID
224.article_body: Director Matt Reeves missed the premiere of his film 'The Batman' after contracting COVID-19. "It's a great heartbreak for me because this movie means so much to me," Reeves said through a video message at the premiere. Reeves informed that he contracted the virus despite receiving double vaccination and a booster shot. "The good news is...I'm healthy," he added.

225.title: Allegations that we were late to start evacuation in Ukraine not right: Union Minister
225.article_body: Union Minister V Muraleedharan on Wednesday said the allegations that the government was late to initiate evacuation of Indian students are not right. "Students didn't want to leave as [Ukrainian] universities were not ready to conduct online classes. We released our first advisory before February 24 for students to leave Ukraine," he stated.

226.title: 60 Madhya Pradesh natives have returned from Ukraine: Minister
226.article_body: As many as 60 Madhya Pradesh natives, out of the 193 who sought assistance from the state government for evacuation from Ukraine, have returned to the state so far, Minister Narottam Mishra said on Wednesday. Madhya Pradesh government has directed Superintendents of Police (SP) of all districts to contact the family members of those stranded in Ukraine, he added.

227.title: Kiren Rijiju reaches Slovakia's Kosice to aid evacuation efforts
227.article_body: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju reached the Slovak city of Kosice near the Ukrainian border to coordinate evacuation of Indians stranded in Ukraine under the government's Operation Ganga, his office said on Wednesday. Union Ministers Hardeep Singh Puri, Jyotiraditya Scindia and General VK Singh (Retd) have also been sent to Ukraine's neighbouring countries to aid evacuation.

228.title: Providing generic medicines to poor is govt's top priority: Minister
228.article_body: Union Minister of State for Chemicals and Fertilisers Bhagwanth Khuba on Wednesday said that the government's top priority is to provide generic medicines to the poor at low cost. "On the occasion of Jan Aushadhi Diwas, we are spreading and highlighting more and more Jan Aushadhi medicines," he said. "Doctors should know more about it," he added.

229.title: UP RERA's NCR forum settled 1,150 property disputes worth over ₹345 cr
229.article_body: UP Real Estate Regulatory Authority's (RERA) NCR conciliation forum has so far settled 1,150 disputes involving properties worth over ₹345 crore, officials said. Most of the disputes came from the allottees of the projects in Gautam Buddha Nagar, Ghaziabad, Meerut and Bulandshahr, they added. The cases pertained to delay in registered sale deed and possession of units to allottees.

230.title: Proceed on foot if you can't find vehicles: India while asking citizens to leave Kharkiv
230.article_body: A second advisory issued by Indian Embassy in Ukraine for Indian nationals in Kharkiv further highlighted the urgency to leave Kharkiv "immediately" in light of the "deteriorating situation". "Those students who cannot find vehicles or buses and are in railway station can proceed on foot," it said. The advisory asked Indian nationals to proceed to Pisochin, Babai and Bezlyudivka.

231.title: Will leave no stone unturned for return of Indians from Ukraine: PM
231.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said India is making every effort to evacuate Indian citizens stranded in Ukraine amid the Russia-Ukraine war. He added that four Union Ministers have been sent to Ukraine's neighbouring countries to aid Operation Ganga. The first flight carrying 219 Indians evacuated from Ukraine landed in Mumbai on February 26, two days after Russia invaded Ukraine.

232.title: Pune Metro services likely to become operational from March 6
232.article_body: The CMRS has reportedly given Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation (MahaMetro) a safety clearance certificate to run Pune Metro from March 6. According to MahaMetro, which is executing the Pune Metro rail project, work on the priority stretch has reportedly been completed. This will open 12-km routes from Vanaz to Garware College and PCMC to Phugewadi lines and 10 metro stations.

233.title: 6 flights with evacuated Indians landed in last 24 hours: MEA
233.article_body: MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Wednesday said six flights carrying Indians evacuated from Ukraine have landed in India in the last 24 hours. A total of 3,352 stranded Indians have so far been rescued and brought back to India in 15 flights, Bagchi said. "As many as 15 flights are scheduled over the next 24 hours. Some...are already...enroute," he added.

234.title: Pope thanks Poland for hosting Ukrainian refugees amid Russian war
234.article_body: Pope Francis on Wednesday expressed gratitude to Poland for proactively taking in Ukrainian refugees and asked people across the world to remember Ukrainians seeking refuge in underground bunkers. "You (Poland) were the first to support Ukraine [by] opening your borders [and]...doors of your homes," he said. Over 4.5 lakh Ukrainians have fled to Poland since the Russian invasion, UN said.

235.title: BJP govt worked for overall well-being of women in UP: PM Modi
235.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said that BJP worked for the overall well-being of women in Uttar Pradesh. While addressing a rally in UP's Ghazipur, the PM stressed the issue of 'chulha' smoke, adding that 2.5 lakh women in the district got Ujjwala gas connections, ensuring smoke-free kitchens. BJP has reduced women's sufferings in the last five years, he added.

236.title: Delhi Police ASI arrested for drug trafficking, marijuana worth ₹2cr seized
236.article_body: A Delhi Police Assistant Sub Inspector and his five associates were arrested for alleged drug trafficking and around 1,370 kg of marijuana worth over ₹2 crore was seized. The drugs was packed in 44 sacks and hidden under coconuts in a truck that came to Haryana from Odisha, police said. The ASI is with Delhi Police's special cell.

237.title: I'm praying Ukrainians succeed in what they're trying to do: Ruffalo
237.article_body: Amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict, actor Mark Ruffalo called Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy a hero. "The Ukrainian people are incredible. They're heroes. Zelenskyy is a hero," Ruffalo stated. "That's what it looks like when people come together to fight for something that's right. I'm praying they succeed in what they're trying to do," he further added.

238.title: Ukrainian ambassador gets standing ovation from UK Parliament; video viral
238.article_body: The Ukrainian ambassador to the UK received a standing ovation from the UK Parliamentarians and the UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson himself on Wednesday. Ukrainian ambassador Vadym Prystaiko was in the public gallery as the UK Parliament gave him a standing ovation. The MPs stood up in applause to show solidarity with the Ukrainian people amid the Russian invasion.

239.title: Urban Company to award stocks worth ₹150 cr to service providers over 5-7 yrs
239.article_body: Urban Company on Wednesday announced a ₹150 crore Partner Stock Ownership Plan (PSOP) for its service providers. Under this plan, Urban Company will award stocks to thousands of service partners over the next 5-7 years. The company has already got board approval for the first tranche of ₹75 crore worth of stocks to be disbursed over the next 3-4 years.

240.title: Tamil Nadu lifts COVID-19 curbs, allows 500 people at weddings
240.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government on Wednesday further eased COVID-19 restrictions and allowed 500 persons to attend weddings and related events. A maximum of 250 people can attend funerals, Chief Minister MK Stalin-led government said. The government added that there are no restrictions on social, cultural and political gatherings. The relaxations will come into effect from Thursday.

241.title: Pic of Belarus President with a map of Russia's 'invasion plan' goes viral
241.article_body: An image of Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko pointing towards a map is going viral with reports claiming it displays the invasion plan in Ukraine. It allegedly shows Ukraine divided into four sections and lines of attack already carried out by Russia. According to New York Post, Lukashenko appeared to be talking about a planned attack from southern Ukraine into Moldova.

242.title: Ujjain creates Guinness World Record by lighting 11.71 lakh diyas
242.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain set a Guinness World Record of "largest display of oil lamps" by lighting 11.71 lakh earthen lamps as part of the Mahashivratri celebrations on March 1. MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, "By...grace of Lord Mahakal...it's a privilege to create a unique record." Last year, Ayodhya had set the record by lighting over nine lakh diyas.

243.title: Don't foresee obstacles: Russia on S-400's delivery to India
243.article_body: Russia's Ambassador-designate to India Denis Alipov said he doesn't foresee any obstacles as far as delivery of five regiments of S-400 missile systems to India is concerned amid the sanctions levied on Russia after it invaded Ukraine. "Sanctions, old or new, don't interfere in any way," he said. He thanked India for 'balanced position' at the UN on the invasion.

244.title: UK to send additional £80 million in aid to Ukraine
244.article_body: The UK government on Tuesday said it has pledged another £80 million ($106.5 million) in aid to Ukraine. The government added this brings the UK's total aid to Ukraine up to £220 million. "Britain is at the forefront of efforts to supply life-saving humanitarian aid, as well as political, economic and defensive support," Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said.

245.title: If Samantha was an athlete, she would have been like Kohli: Trainer
245.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu's personal trainer Junaid Shaikh said he "always" tells Samantha, "If you were an athlete, you would have been like Virat Kohli." "Samantha...has an attitude wherein she will just say...'I will try and do it again'. She is very aggressive and wants to do things to the core," added Junaid. "I take motivation from her," he stated.

246.title: 61-yr-old man, wife get life imprisonment for killing relative in TN
246.article_body: A 61-year-old man and his 59-year-old wife were sentenced to life imprisonment for killing a relative in Tamil Nadu's Karur. In 2018, the couple engaged in a scuffle with their relative as he wanted to erect a fence around their home. The couple attacked him with a wooden log, following which he was taken to a hospital where he died.

247.title: Grateful to PM Modi for allowing Indians to return with pets from war-hit Ukraine: PETA
247.article_body: PETA India said it's grateful to PM Narendra Modi and Union Ministers Parshottam Rupala and Sanjeev Balyan "for including companion animals in the evacuation operation of Indians who are stuck in war-hit Ukraine" following its appeal. "Separating animal companions from their guardians would have resulted in more tragedy," PETA added. Earlier, a student refused to leave Ukraine without his pet.

248.title: Williamson is a very fun guy and listens to everyone: Abhishek Sharma
248.article_body: Terming SRH captain Kane Williamson as a "very fun guy" who listens to everyone, SRH all-rounder Abhishek Sharma said he has a "great understanding" with Williamson. "The quality that I like the most about Williamson is his composure and calmness in pressure situations," added Abhishek. Abhishek was bought by SRH for ₹6.5 crore in the mega auction.

249.title: Technology is a medium to empower the people of India: PM Modi
249.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said that technology is a medium to empower the people of the country, adding that it is the mainstay of making India self-reliant. While addressing a webinar on "technology-enabled development", the PM highlighted the expanding global market for gaming and said that the Budget has focussed on Animation, Visual Effects, Gaming and Comic (AVGC).

250.title: PWD to redevelop Delhi's accident-prone Rohtak Road
250.article_body: The Public Works Department (PWD) will redevelop the accident-prone Rohtak Road, which connects the Nangloi-Najafgarh crossing to the Tikri Border. The road safety cell of the transport department, in a study called 'Delhi Road Clash Fatalities Report', declared it unsafe for pedestrians and cyclists. The report states that in 2020 alone, 13 people were killed in hit-and-run cases.

251.title: Representations on crypto regulations have been made to govt: Ex-SEBI chief
251.article_body: Former SEBI Chairman Ajay Tyagi on Wednesday said the regulator has made representations to the government on regulation of cryptocurrencies in India. Tyagi said SEBI has been in discussion with the government since November 2021 and has made several representations. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced in Budget 2022 that a 30% tax will be imposed on all virtual digital assets.

252.title: PCMC will have to recycle sewage water after 10-15 yrs: Ex-official
252.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad will have to recycle sewage water after 10-15 years amid growing population in the region, former joint city engineer of Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) Pravin Ladkat has said. Ladkat added that there are only three dams and no additional sources for water in Pimpri-Chinchwad. PCMC is planning to increase sewage treatment plants and their capacities, he further said.

253.title: Kohli is a great player, will come back and get hundreds: Ganguly
253.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli not scoring a century in international cricket since November 2019, Sourav Ganguly said Kohli is a "great" player who has batted marvellously and will get hundreds. "He has enormous ability," added Ganguly. Kohli will play his 100th Test when India take on Sri Lanka in the first Test, with Ganguly terming it as a "fantastic landmark".

254.title: Russia banned from tennis team events; players allowed in ATP, WTA events
254.article_body: Russia has been banned from participating in team events, while players are allowed to compete in Grand Slams and regular ATP and WTA events but not using Russia's flag or name. "The international governing bodies of tennis stand united in our condemnation of Russia's actions," a joint statement by the International Tennis Federation (ITF), the ATP and the WTA said.

255.title: Indians in Ukraine may have miscalculated situation despite advisory: Fadnavis
255.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday said India had issued an advisory days before the Russian invasion in Ukraine but Indian students may have miscalculated the gravity of the situation. He was asked if there was a delay in evacuation on the government's part. Opposition parties have been criticising the government after a student from Karnataka was killed in Ukraine.

256.title: Ukraine's Zinchenko captains Man City in their 2-0 FA Cup 5th round win
256.article_body: Manchester City on Tuesday beat Peterborough United 2-0 in fifth round to reach the quarter-finals of the FA Cup. Riyad Mahrez scored City's first goal before Jack Grealish scored his first ever FA Cup goal. Manchester City were captained by Ukraine international Oleksandr Zinchenko, who made his first appearance for the club since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began last week.

257.title: Pune wildlife researcher Dharmaraj Patil dies aged 42 after illness
257.article_body: Wildlife researcher and environment educator Dharmaraj Patil has passed away aged 42 in Pune, Maharashtra, following a brief illness. The ornithologist was also a poet and an author and his research work included a study on critically endangered Forest Owlet and endemic birds of Northern Western Ghats. He died on Tuesday, and his last rites were performed at Vaikunth crematorium.

258.title: Canada bans Russian-owned ships from entering its ports
258.article_body: Canada on Tuesday said it will ban all Russian-owned ships from entering its ports following the invasion of Ukraine. Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Monday said Canada will ban crude oil imports from Russia. Government officials said they are tracking three Russian-flagged vessels off Canada's east coast. Canada imported $1.68 billion worth of goods from Russia in 2021.

259.title: Inflation hits all-time-high of 5.8% in 19 nations using euro
259.article_body: Consumer inflation in the 19 countries that use the euro currency increased by an annual 5.8% in February 2022,  European Union statistics agency Eurostat said on Wednesday. It's the highest level since recordkeeping for the euro started in 1997. Inflation in Europe, as in other major economies, has been increasing by surging energy prices following Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

260.title: Ashneer shares pic of bed made on floor after BharatPe's 'lavish lifestyle' allegation
260.article_body: Ashneer Grover on Wednesday took to LinkedIn to share a picture of a bed made on the floor following BharatPe's allegations against him of committing fraud to fund his "lavish lifestyle". "I indeed have a very lavish lifestyle. I get invited by friends with open hearts to their homes, where I have no qualms sleeping on the floor," wrote Ashneer.

261.title: Passport helps save life of 16-yr-old Ukrainian boy amid war, pic goes viral
261.article_body: A 16-year-old boy's life was saved after a piece of shrapnel got stuck in his passport in Ukraine's Mariupol amid war with Russia. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs shared a picture of the passport and wrote that the boy is in surgery now. "Praying for his full and speedy recovery," a user commented on the picture.

262.title: No longer have to knock at directors' door: Anchal on 'Yeh Kaali...'
262.article_body: Actress Anchal Singh has said she can finally relax after doing 'Yeh Kaali Kaali Ankhein'. She added, "I no longer have to knock at the door of directors and say, 'Sir, I have done this, I have done that, and I have done that too'." "From a nobody to this Anchal Singh, this journey has been quite long," she said.

263.title: Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor's film to release on March 8, 2023
263.article_body: Taking to Twitter, Luv Films announced that director Luv Ranjan's untitled next, starring actor Ranbir Kapoor, will release on March 8, 2023. The film will also feature actress Shraddha Kapoor. Luv Ranjan and Ankur Garg will produce the film. This will be the first time that Ranbir and Shraddha will work together in a film.

264.title: 2 men killed, 2 others injured in accident on Delhi-Haridwar highway
264.article_body: Two men were killed and two others were severely injured in an accident on the Delhi-Haridwar highway on Tuesday night, police said. The four friends from Ghaziabad were going to Haridwar to take bath in the Ganga when another car hit the car in which they were travelling, resulting in the death of two. The injured persons have been hospitalised.

265.title: Leave Ukraine's Kharkiv immediately for your safety: India to its nationals
265.article_body: Amid reports of heavy shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv, Indian Embassy in Ukraine advised all its nationals to leave Kharkiv immediately "for their safety and security". They have been told to proceed to Pesochin, Babaye and Bezlyudovka as soon as possible and reach these settlements by 6 pm (Ukrainian time) on Wednesday "under all circumstances".

266.title: Nigeria to airlift hundreds stranded by war in Ukraine
266.article_body: Nigeria said it's sending three jets to bring back nearly 1,300 citizens stranded in Ukraine's neighbouring nations after fleeing the war. "First batch of evacuees are expected to arrive...on Thursday," it added. African countries have been scrambling to help their citizens living in Ukraine amid reports of racism and being blocked from crossing the borders into Poland, Romania and Hungary.

267.title: Nawab Malik being framed for calling Aryan innocent: Maha NCP Chief
267.article_body: Maharashtra NCP chief Jayant Patil on Wednesday said NCP leader Nawab Malik is being framed as he revealed that "Aryan Khan was framed". Actor Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan was arrested in connection with a drugs raid conducted by the Narcotics Control Bureau on October 3 last year. He was accused of consumption and possession of drugs.

268.title: Each vote cast in UP will take BJP towards record victory: PM Modi
268.article_body: Addressing rally in UP's Ghazipur on Wednesday, PM Narendra Modi said that each vote cast in UP Assembly elections will take BJP towards record victory. Every vote will give "befitting" response to "pariwarwadi" (dynastic) parties, that had altered UP's identity and made state famous for 'mafia', he added. Sixth phase polling for 57 UP Assembly seats will be held tomorrow.

269.title: From boyfriend-girlfriend to mom-dad: Preity on her 6th wedding anniversary
269.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta recently celebrated her wedding anniversary with her husband Gene Goodenough. Sharing a picture from their wedding day on Instagram, Preity wrote, "Happy Anniversary my Love. I love you. Thank you...for loving all of me and for making me laugh all the time. You are my best friend & confidant...From Boyfriend-girlfriend to husband-wife and now mom-dad."

270.title: To my inspiration & role model: Rakul Preet Singh wishes dad on his b'day
270.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh wished her father Kulvinder Singh on his birthday. Taking to Instagram, Rakul Preet wrote, "Happy birthday to my inspiration, my role model. I look up to you every single day for the fearless strong person you are, for all the knowledge and wisdom you have. I'm the luckiest to have you guide me through everything."

271.title: Maha govt saving Nawab Malik who helped Mumbai blasts accused Dawood: Fadnavis
271.article_body: Calling for Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik's resignation, former CM Devendra Fadnavis accused the state government of protecting him. "People whose hands are stained with the blood of innocent people who died in the Mumbai blast are being supported by the Shiv Sena-led government," he said. Malik was involved in money laundering with bomb blast accused Dawood Ibrahim, he said.

272.title: 22-year-old Indian student dies in Ukraine days after suffering stroke
272.article_body: Chandan Jindal, a 22-year-old student studying at the National Pirogov Memorial Medical University in Ukraine's Vinnytsia, passed away at a hospital in the city today. He hailed from Punjab's Barnala. He had suffered an Ischemic stroke in February and was admitted to the ICU. His father has written to Indian government to make arrangements for bringing back his body.

273.title: Maha govt refuses to allow unvaccinated persons to board Mumbai local trains
273.article_body: The Maharashtra government informed the Bombay High Court on Wednesday that it won't allow people not vaccinated against COVID-19 to board local trains in Mumbai. Last month, HC had asked the government to "let bygones be bygones" and start afresh. Expressing disappointment at the order, HC said today that almost all activities in Mumbai are being performed like pre-pandemic days.

274.title: Ukrainian refugees to get EU protection for up to 3 years: Germany
274.article_body: The German government has said that the European Union will offer immediate protection to refugees from Ukraine for up to three years. "We will provide help quickly and without bureaucracy. Refugees from Ukraine do not need to go through the asylum procedure," Germany's Interior Minister Nancy Faeser said. They will also get access to health insurance and jobs, she added.

275.title: 25-yr-old unidentified man killed, set on fire in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur
275.article_body: A 25-year-old man was killed and set on fire by an unidentified miscreant near Yashoda Nagar bypass in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. The unidentified victim's half-burnt body was recovered by the locals in the area after they spotted flames emanating from a hut. Before setting the victim's body ablaze, the accused had crushed his head and face with bricks, police said.

276.title: DK Shivakumar apologises for traffic jams in B'luru amid Mekedatu rally
276.article_body: Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar has apologised for traffic jams caused due to Mekedatu Padayatra in Bengaluru. Shivakumar said, "I want to apologise to the people of Bengaluru...There may be traffic trouble for three days...but it will solve your water-related issues for the next 50 years." "Our fight is for the people of [Karnataka] and citizens of Bengaluru," he added.

277.title: People knew I battled drug abuse; they wouldn't offer me jobs: Prateik
277.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar said at his lowest phase in his career, he was "rejected by people many times". Prateik added for two years, he worked in plays "for free". "It was my own doing and my own battles that I was fighting...People [knew] about the substance and alcohol abuse I battled...[they] were wary of working with me," Prateik said.

278.title: Making Hrithik talk without moving a limb in Guzaarish was courage: Bhansali
278.article_body: Sanjay Leela Bhansali said lot of people felt his filmmaking was moving in the same direction. He added, "They had almost written off my career after...'Guzaarish'." Bhansali added he was fearless when he made 'Guzaarish'. "I [took Hrithik Roshan], who's considered...Greek God in Hindi cinema, who's known for dancing and action...[Making him talk] without moving a limb...was courage," he said.

279.title: SC to hear plea seeking FIR against political parties for bribing voters
279.article_body: The Supreme Court said it would hear a plea on Thursday seeking direction to register FIRs against political parties for inducing voters by offering freebies. "Election bribing is taking place everywhere...It's not for a particular state," CJI NV Ramana said. The plea demands disqualification of all members of Congress, SP in UP and AAP candidates in Punjab in Assembly election.

280.title: Google, Meta may face penalty for failing to open local offices in Russia
280.article_body: Google and Meta are among the firms that may face possible punitive measures in Russia over failure to open local offices and take other measures required by a communications law. The law requires foreign social media firms with over 5,00,000 daily users to open local offices. Besides Google and Meta, TikTok, Zoom and Twitter have also not established local offices.

281.title: It's not war, it's like India's surgical strike: India-born legislator from Putin's party
281.article_body: Indian-origin legislator and member of Russian President Vladimir Putin's party, Dr Abhay Kumar Singh, has come out in support of the military action against Ukraine. In an interview with Aaj Tak, he said, "This is not war; it's like India's surgical strike." "If the military enters a supermarket and...attacks Russian soldiers, we'll have to reply," he stated.

282.title: Google, MeitY list 100 Indian startups that'll get help to build apps
282.article_body: Google and India's Ministry of Electronics and IT's Startup Hub have unveiled the inaugural cohort of 100 Indian startups as part of Appscale Academy. The initiative aims to help startups build high-quality global apps and games. The startups were chosen from over 400 applications following a selection process that took into account their creative ideas and innovation, among other things.

283.title: Who is Joshua Davis, the 13-year-old boy who went viral after Biden's speech?
283.article_body: US President Joe Biden mentioned Joshua Davis, who attended his State of the Union speech, while discussing the need to cap insulin prices. Joshua was diagnosed with Type-1 diabetes when he was 11 months old and has raised awareness about the same since he was 4. During his speech, Biden wished Joshua, who turned 13 on Monday, a "happy birthday".

284.title: Samasta Hindu Aghadi chief Milind Ekbote booked for spreading misinformation
284.article_body: Samasta Hindu Aghadi's chief Milind Ekbote and 20 others were booked for distributing provocative pamphlets and circulating misinformation on social media to drive a wedge between two communities. The accused misled people about construction work at a Muslim shrine near Punyeshwar Mahadev Temple in Pune despite a court's stay and performed rituals there on Mahashivratri, the police said.

285.title: Kolkata woman raped by tantric on pretext of curing her ailing husband
285.article_body: An astrologer-cum-tantric was arrested for raping a woman on the pretext of curing her ailing husband in Kolkata's Chitpur. The woman alleged that the accused claimed he would perform yagnas to save her husband and took her to different places for performing rituals. She told police, he spiked her drink and raped her on two occasions when she became unconscious.

286.title: Russia's largest lender Sberbank to exit Europe, cites abnormal cash outflows
286.article_body: Russia's largest lender Sberbank is leaving almost all European markets after coming under pressure of Western sanctions that were imposed following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "The group's subsidiary banks have faced abnormal cash outflows and threats to the safety of its employees and branches," it said. Earlier, the European Central Bank (ECB) ordered the closure of Sberbank's European arm.

287.title: Madras HC closes contempt case linked to river linking project
287.article_body: Madras High Court has closed a contempt case filed in 2017 by DMK leader M Appavu in connection with Tamil Nadu's Thamirabarani-Karumeniyar-Nambiar river linking project. There is no wilful disobedience of an order passed in 2015 with regard to the implementation of the project, HC said. No case is made out for initiating contempt proceedings, HC added.

288.title: Vehicles stuck in traffic for 4 hrs amid Mekedatu rally in B'luru: Report
288.article_body: Several vehicles were stuck in traffic snarl for about four hours due to the Congress' Mekedatu Padayatra in Bengaluru, a report stated. Meanwhile, Bengaluru Police has deployed about 1,000 policemen across the city following the Congress rally. Furthermore, the police has also issued an advisory of alternative routes for commuters to avoid getting stuck in traffic jams in the city.

289.title: We're ready for 2nd round of talks, not sure if Ukraine will join: Russia
289.article_body: Russian officials are ready to hold a second round of talks with Ukraine on Wednesday, but it's unclear whether the "Ukrainian negotiators will show up or not", Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday had said that Russia must stop bombing Ukrainian cities before more talks on a ceasefire could take place.

290.title: I clicked Alia & Ranbir's 1st picture when she was just 9: Bhansali
290.article_body: Sanjay Leela Bhansali said he clicked Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's first picture together when she was just nine years old during Black's shoot. Bhansali added, "[I told Alia to] put her head on Ranbir's shoulders. She said 'no', she was...shy." "I [was] talking to Soni (Razdan) and suddenly I [saw] her head...on...Ranbir's shoulder...I [still] have that picture," he added.

291.title: DU female teacher says 2 colleagues harassed her; NCW writes to VC
291.article_body: A female teacher of Delhi University has accused her two male colleagues of harassing her and misbehaving with her. She alleged that the two teachers humiliated her by trying to stop her from attending a governing body meeting. The National Commission for Women has written to the Delhi University Vice-Chancellor to send an action taken report at the earliest.

292.title: 28-yr-old kills girlfriend in Delhi hotel over suspicion of affair
292.article_body: A 28-year-old man has been arrested from Uttar Pradesh for allegedly killing his girlfriend in Hotel Lak Residency in Delhi's Vasant Kunj area, police said on Tuesday. During interrogation, the accused revealed he killed the woman because she had been deceiving him and was in a relationship with another man, Deputy Commissioner of Police (southwest) Gaurav Sharma said.

293.title: People who mock Atmanirbhar Abhiyan can never strengthen India: PM
293.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said those who make fun of 'Atmanirbhar Bharat Abhiyan' can never strengthen India. "People who mock Atmanirbhar Abhiyan, insult our (defence) forces...such dynasts can never strengthen India," PM Modi said while addressing a rally in Sonbhadra. "They are the same people who spread rumours about the country's COVID-19 vaccine," PM Modi added.

294.title: Even if Ishan performs with 60-70% of his ability, he'll be in team: Bangar
294.article_body: Former Team India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said that Ishan Kishan will be India's top choice for the opening role at the T20 World Cup even if he performs with 60-70 per cent of his ability. "He plays with a strike rate which India need at the top order...he also provides the right-left combination at the top," Bangar explained.

295.title: Mumbai to soon get ward-wise helpline numbers for civic complaints
295.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is launching ward-wise helpline numbers to help citizens register civic complaints. The numbers for each of the 24 wards will be launched after current term of corporators ends on March 7. The helpline will address civic issues directly, a BMC official said. The existing helpline number 1916 will continue to operate, the official added.

296.title: Trinamool Congress wins 93 of 107 municipalities in WB civic polls
296.article_body: CM Mamata Banerjee-led Trinamool Congress on Wednesday steamrolled the Opposition by winning 93 of 107 municipalities in the civic polls, an SEC official said. TMC also won from Kanthi, the bastion of Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari. Congratulating the winners and thanking voters, Banerjee tweeted, "Let victory enhance our responsibility and dedication. Let triumph impart humility."

297.title: 3 armed men rob 2 men of their valuables during morning walk in UP
297.article_body: Three armed men robbed two men of their valuables during their morning walk in the Sector 11 market area in Ghaziabad's Vasundhara in UP on Tuesday, police said. "All the three men pulled out guns...made me take off my gold ring at gunpoint...snatched [my friend's] gold chain...asked him to take off his gold ring," one of the victims said.

298.title: Tons of space junk likely to punch a 20-metre deep hole in Moon
298.article_body: A leftover rocket weighing three tons is expected to smash into the side of the moon that faces away from the Earth at a speed of 9,300 kph on March 4. Scientists think this impact would likely carve out a hole 10 to 20 meters deep in the surface of the moon. Experts believe the junk rocket belongs to China.

299.title: RJD calls Bihar govt's new liquor order 'ridiculous'
299.article_body: The Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) criticised the Nitish Kumar-led government's announcement that people caught drinking alcohol will not be jailed but will be asked to share information on the liquor mafia and called it "ridiculous". The announcement proves that the liquor prohibition policy has failed in Bihar and it should be ended, RJD spokesperson Mrityunjay Tiwary said.

300.title: Alert sounded in Mumbai-bound flight after man smokes cigar mid-air
300.article_body: A smoke alert was sounded in a Mumbai-bound flight after a 36-year-old man lit up cigar mid-air in the plane's bathroom. Subsequently, the plane's crew rushed to the bathroom, extinguished the cigar and asked the man to be seated. The man, who said he hadn't acted deliberately but was only curious, was later arrested for endangering the life of others.

301.title: Over 2,500 Chinese nationals in Ukraine have been relocated: Official
301.article_body: Over 2,500 Chinese nationals stranded in Ukraine have been moved out of the country, Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Wang Wenbin said on Wednesday. Chinese citizens reportedly travelled from Kyiv and Odessa, among other places, to Poland, Slovakia and Moldova. Around 6,000 Chinese nationals resided in Ukraine either for education or work purposes.

302.title: Avesh Khan should receive same backing as Siraj: Irfan Pathan
302.article_body: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has said pacer Avesh Khan should receive the same backing as Mohammed Siraj received from ex-captain Virat Kohli. "Kohli should be credited for the confidence with which Siraj bowls in international cricket. So yes, players need that backing. And I believe Avesh should [also] receive backing...because he has that talent," Irfan stated.

303.title: 7 teams formed to probe murder of 3 CNG station employees in Gurugram
303.article_body: Gurugram Police on Tuesday said seven teams have been formed to probe murder of three employees of a CNG station on a service lane off NH-48 in Sector 31. We're scanning footage of over 100 CCTV cameras, added the police. "Suspects were armed with sharp-edged weapons and didn't take much time to attack and flee," said ACP (Crime) Preet Pal.

304.title: Video of pre-wedding festivities of Supriya Pathak's daughter Sanah surfaces
304.article_body: A video from the pre-wedding festivities of actress Sanah Kapur, who will be marrying Mayank Pahwa, son of actor Manoj Pahwa, has surfaced. The video shows Sanah's mother and actress Supriya Pathak dancing with her sister and actress Ratna Pathak Shah. Pankaj Kapur had, on Monday, said, "I don't want to talk much, but yes it is my daughter's wedding."

305.title: US troops in Europe not to fight in Ukraine, but to defend allies: Biden
305.article_body: US President Joe Biden said American troops were deployed to Europe not to fight in Ukraine, "but to defend our NATO allies [if]...Russian President Vladimir Putin decides to keep moving west". The US has deployed troops to many NATO countries, including Poland, Latvia, Lithuania, and Estonia. Earlier, Biden had said that Putin wants to "re-establish the former Soviet Union".

306.title: 1,080 kg of sea cucumber worth crores seized in Tamil Nadu
306.article_body: Based on a tip-off, Coastal Security Group of Tamil Nadu Police conducted a raid at an old building near Akkaraipettai on Tuesday and seized sea cucumbers worth crores in international market. They recovered 248 kg and 812 kg of preserved and unpreserved sea cucumbers respectively, along with 4 kg preserved sea horses and 15 kg shark wings during the raid.

307.title: Constable on poll duty killed, 11 others injured in Manipur accident
307.article_body: An India Reserve Battalion (IRB) constable was killed and 11 others were injured in an accident in Manipur's Tamenglong district. They were reportedly going for poll duty to Manipur from Mizoram. Five of the injured were flown to Imphal for treatment. According to police, the driver might have lost control of the vehicle as the road was narrow.

308.title: If World War 3 takes place, it will involve nuclear weapons: Russia
308.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Wednesday that if World War 3 were to take place, it would involve nuclear weapons and be destructive. Lavrov further said that Russia would face a "real danger" if Ukraine acquired nuclear weapons. This comes a week after Russia ordered military operation in Ukraine.

309.title: Liquor vendors move HC against Delhi govt's order stopping discount on alcohol
309.article_body: A group of private liquor license holders have approached the Delhi High Court challenging the Delhi government's February 28 order which barred them from giving discounts on alcohol. The government said the decision was taken in view of overcrowding at liquor shops. "The rules of the game cannot be changed after the game has begun," the petitioners said.

310.title: UGC draft rules allow institutes to source 40% content externally for online degrees
310.article_body: Institutes offering online degrees can source up to 40% of their course content externally and develop the remaining 60% in-house, as per UGC draft guidelines. This will prevent students from putting extra effort in locating good online programmes to pursue, a senior UGC official said. "The institutes themselves will do the research and provide options to students," the official added.

311.title: He's shaping up well: Bumrah on Ashwin's fitness ahead of Mohali Test
311.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has provided an update on Ravichandran Ashwin's fitness ahead of the Mohali Test against Sri Lanka, starting on March 4. "Ashwin is shaping up well...I'm not aware [if] there are any complaints...He was bowling, batting, fielding, he did everything," stated Bumrah. Ashwin was ruled out of the West Indies series due to an unknown injury.

312.title: Russia to investigate 21-yr-old Indian student's death in Ukraine: Russian envoy
312.article_body: Russia will investigate the death of the 21-year-old Indian medical student in Ukraine's Kharkiv, Russian Ambassador-designate Denis Alipov said on Wednesday. Alipov offered his "deepest condolences" over the death of Naveen Gyanagoudar and conveyed his sympathy to the student's family in Karnataka. "Russia will do everything to ensure the safety of Indians in conflict zones," he added.

313.title: Russian soldiers punching holes in their vehicles, crying, firing at each other: Reports
313.article_body: Russian troops in Ukraine are suffering from low morale and have deliberately punched holes in their vehicles' gas tanks, a Pentagon official said, reported New York Times. They are reportedly also suffering from food and fuel shortages. Voice recordings obtained by a British intelligence company reveal they were heard crying and sometimes even firing at each other, said reports.

314.title: Pathaan time starts now: SRK shares release date of his film 'Pathaan'
314.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan took to Twitter to announce that his film 'Pathaan' will release on January 25, 2023 in theatres, adding, "I know it's late, but remember the date. Pathaan time starts now." 'Pathaan' also stars Deepika Padukone and John Abraham. 'Pathaan' marks Deepika's fourth film with Shah Rukh, having made her debut alongside him in 'Om Shanti Om'.

315.title: US sanctions on Russia won't affect us significantly: IAF Vice Chief
315.article_body: Vice Chief of Air Staff Air Marshal Sandeep Singh on Wednesday said US sanctions imposed on Russia amid the Russia-Ukraine war "won't affect us significantly". "Things are still unfolding. Our position is very strong and our relations with both the countries have remained (strong)," Singh said. He added that India's "relations with Russia will continue" despite a difficult geopolitical situation.

316.title: Robberies, rapes rising in Ukraine as govt arms civilians amid war: Man in video
316.article_body: In a video filmed in Kyiv on February 28, a man claimed that criminals in Ukraine have got their hands on military-grade weapons after President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's regime declared that it would arm all civilians willing to fight against Russia. "There have been robberies, rapes and all kinds of havoc due to this," he said.

317.title: Child cancer patients sheltered in basement in Ukraine's Kharkiv amid war
317.article_body: A video has emerged that shows child cancer patients sheltering in a basement in Kharkiv, Ukraine's second-largest city, amid the Russian invasion. Ukrainian MP Lesia Vasylenko shared the video on Twitter and wrote, "Little cancer patients in Kharkiv basement. These are unfit conditions for children who suffer enough as it is already!"

318.title: Latest rankings for T20I batters released, Shreyas Iyer jumps 27 spots
318.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for T20I batters, with India's Shreyas Iyer jumping 27 spots to be ranked 18th. Meanwhile, KL Rahul dropped four spots to be ranked 10th. He is the only Indian in the top 10. Sri Lanka's Pathum Nissanka moved up six spots to be ranked ninth in the rankings led by Pakistan's Babar Azam.

319.title: Biden praises only Ford & GM in State of the Union speech; Tesla CEO Musk reacts
319.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted to US President Joe Biden after he praised GM and Ford for investing billions on electric vehicles and didn't include Tesla in State of the Union address. "Tesla...created over 50,000 US jobs building EVs & is investing more than double GM + Ford combined. [FYI to person controlling this Twitter]," the Tesla CEO said.

320.title: India needs to be economically strong to not be lectured on freedom: Zoho CEO
320.article_body: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu in a tweet discussing India being "lectured" on democracy, freedom and the global order by others, said, "The only way for India not to get lectured is to be technologically self-reliant and economically strong." He added that sustained efforts will take India 10-20 years to achieve technological parity. "There are no shortcuts," Vembu said.

321.title: Pending bills worth ₹800 cr for traffic violations in Hyd: T'gana Police
321.article_body: Telangana Police said that pending bills for traffic violations amount to ₹1,500 crore in the state as nearly five crore challans remain unpaid by citizens. Hyderabad accounts for ₹800 crore worth of pending bills for traffic violations, it added. Most of them pertain to the last two years, some of the challans date back to 2014, Hyderabad Police stated.

322.title: Hyd software employee posts fake ad to rent out area on Quikr; held
322.article_body: A software employee has been apprehended for allegedly giving fake advertisements on Quikr and taking advance payments from people in Hyderabad. Police have seized a car and an iPhone from him. The accused gave an advertisement on the online platform about an office with a 2,400-square feet area and quoted ₹35,000 as rent and ₹50,000 as advance for it.

323.title: Never cheated in my relationship, might've been cheated upon: Ananya
323.article_body: Speaking about infidelity, actress Ananya Panday said she has never cheated in a relationship. "Maybe I have been cheated upon but I'm not sure," she added. Ananya's 'Gehraiyaan' co-star Siddhant Chaturvedi also said he's never cheated in a relationship. "It has to be...black or white for me. I cannot live in the grey area. It messes things up," he added.

324.title: Taiwan leaders to donate 1 month's salary for Ukraine relief measures
324.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen said on Wednesday that she, Vice President William Lai and Premier Su Tseng-chang will each donate their one month's salary towards humanitarian efforts in war-torn Ukraine. President Tsai receives around $14,250 (₹10.7 lakh) per month as remuneration, Reuters reported. Additionally, the Taiwanese government has sent 27 tonnes of medical supplies to Ukraine.

325.title: Govt working day & night for you: Union Minister to Indian evacuees from Ukraine
325.article_body: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Wednesday welcomed Indian nationals evacuated from Ukraine, in Delhi. "All of you have come with a sad memory to India. Many of you must not have been able to sleep for hours, days…Government working day and night for you," Shekhawat said while interacting with the evacuees.

326.title: Stop asking me questions on Russian invasion: Chelsea manager Tuchel
326.article_body: Reacting to a question by a journalist on the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel said, "How often do I need to say it? It's horrible. You have to stop asking me these questions." "Everybody in Europe has some noise in their head that nobody likes," added Tuchel. "We have the right to focus on sports," he stated.

327.title: It is a crime to play a dot ball in T20s: Shreyas Iyer
327.article_body: Shreyas Iyer said it is a "crime" to play a dot ball in T20s adding that players need to work on intent. Shreyas was the highest run-scorer in India's T20I series against Sri Lanka, scoring 204 runs at a strike rate of 174.35. He will lead KKR in IPL 2022 having been signed for ₹12.25 crore in the mega auction.

328.title: State Election Commission acting as slave to WB govt: BJP’s Anirban Ganguly
328.article_body: BJP leader Anirban Ganguly criticised WB CM Mamata Banerjee for the alleged violence during civic body polls and said the State Election Commission is acting as a "slave" to the WB government. "The Supreme Court and the Kolkata HC should introspect (the alleged violence) because when we filed a plea seeking deployment of Central security forces...It was dismissed," Ganguly added.

329.title: Mumbai Police summons Narayan Rane & son in Disha Salian case
329.article_body: The Mumbai Police has sent a notice to Union Minister Narayan Rane and his son Nitesh Rane, asking them to record statements this week in connection to the Disha Salian death case. An FIR was registered against the duo for allegedly spreading false information about Salian's death. Salian was the former manager of late Bollywood actor Sushant Singh Rajput.

330.title: BBPV demands reduction of bus fares in Bengaluru in state Budget
330.article_body: Bengaluru Bus Prayanikara Vedike has started a petition demanding reduction in bus fares and making travel free for women, transgenders and senior citizens. It asked the state government to allocate ₹1,000 crore to Bangalore Metropolitan Transport Corporation in the upcoming state Budget to reduce the fare. BMTC fares, the highest in India, are strangling the working class, the petition read.

331.title: 21-yr-old Indian student's friends sent pic of his dead body from Ukraine: K'taka CM
331.article_body: After 21-year-old Indian Medical student Naveen was killed in shelling in Ukraine, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "Naveen's friends have sent a photo of his body, sending it to MEA to confirm the same." Adding that Naveen's family will be compensated, CM Bommai said, "We're in touch with the Indian Embassy so that at least the body is secured."

332.title: Tamil Nadu govt releases examination schedule for classes 10, 11 and 12
332.article_body: Tamil Nadu's Department of School Education has released the examination schedule for classes 10, 11 and 12. The examination for class 10 will be held from May 6 to May 30 and the examination for class 12 will be held from May 5 to May 28. The examination for class 11 will be held from May 10 to May 31.

333.title: India able to evacuate citizens from Ukraine due to its rising power: PM
333.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said it's because of India's rising power that the government is able to evacuate its citizens from Ukraine. "Those who questioned valour of armed forces and 'Make in India' can't make country strong," he said at a rally in UP's Sonbhadra. He added that the government is making all efforts to evacuate citizens from Ukraine.

334.title: Sea phase of multilateral naval exercise MILAN-22 begins in Bay of Bengal
334.article_body: The sea phase of multilateral naval exercise MILAN-22 commenced in the Bay of Bengal on Tuesday. A total of 26 ships, 21 aircraft and one submarine are participating in the event which includes weapon firings and seamanship evolutions, among other exercises. The event aims at enhancing interoperability and maritime cooperation while sharing best practices among the participating navies.

335.title: Russia sees no desire from Ukraine to find legitimate solution: Envoy
335.article_body: Russian ambassador to UN Gennady Gatilov said Moscow sees "no desire on the part of Ukraine" to reach a legitimate and balanced solution to the problems between the countries. Russia "supports diplomacy based on respect for the positions of all countries and equality, but for now, we don't see that", he added. Russia and Ukraine held peace talks on Monday.

336.title: MoS MEA V Muraleedharan interacts with parents of students stuck in Ukraine
336.article_body: MoS MEA V Muraleedharan interacted with parents of students who are stranded in several parts of Ukraine amid the Russia-Ukraine crisis. He also updated the parents on the ongoing rescue operations under Operation Ganga. The meeting reportedly happened in Pune. Meanwhile, Union Ministers Smriti Irani, Gajendra Shekhawat and Rajeev Chandrasekhar welcomed Indians as they returned from Ukraine.

337.title: Honda suspends car, motorcycle exports to Russia amid invasion
337.article_body: Honda has suspended its automobile and motorcycle exports to Russia, amid growing sanctions on Russia in protest against its invasion of Ukraine. A Honda spokesperson said exports to Russia were already suspended as of Wednesday. The firm's suspension is reportedly based on complications with its distribution networks and concerns surrounding sanctions against Russia.

338.title: Robbers raid house posing as IT officials near B'luru; steal ₹35 lakh
338.article_body: Six men conducted a raid at a tomato trader's house near Bengaluru after posing as Income Tax officials and robbed him of ₹35 lakh cash and jewellery worth ₹20 lakh. The robbers reportedly said they had orders to search the house and showed him files with CBI imprints. However, they later threatened the trader with knife after he got suspicious.

339.title: NDMC to provide scholarship to children of sanitation workers
339.article_body: The New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) has decided to provide 'Palika Swachchta Scholarship' to help children of sanitation workers get admission to professional courses. "This scholarship will help...children in getting admission in medical, engineering and UPSC coaching or preparation," an official said. It will be implemented from the academic year 2022-2023, NDMC member Kuljeet Chahal said.

340.title: Pic of Indian girl carrying her pet dog from Ukraine amid war goes viral
340.article_body: A picture of Indian Medical student Arya Aldrin carrying her pet dog Zaira from Ukraine amid war is going viral on social media. The duo reportedly crossed over to Romania. Kerala Minister V Sivankutty praised her online and wrote, "Without abandoning her pet dog, Arya is on her way to India from a war-torn country...the world benefits from such love."

341.title: 4 die while cleaning septic tank at Pune residential building
341.article_body: Four people died due to suffocation while cleaning a septic tank at a residential building in Pune's Kadam Wak Wasti area on Wednesday, police said. The victims include those who were engaged in cleaning and those who look after the functioning of the residential colony. One of the deceased has been identified, the police said.

342.title: We were sleepless, listening to stories of pain: Pallavi on 'The Kashmir...'
342.article_body: Actress Pallavi Joshi said she and director Vivek Agnihotri "were just listening to stories of the pain" before the 'The Kashmir Files' was rolled out. "Vivek and I used to reach back to hotel...gaze at ceiling...we were sleepless for hours...It was impossible to emotionally unwind...I told Vivek I was going back...I wasn't able to take more pain," Joshi said.

343.title: Ukraine to receive more missiles & Turkish drones: Defence Min
343.article_body: Ukrainian Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov on Wednesday said the country was set to receive Stinger and Javelin missiles from abroad and another shipment of Turkish drones. Many Western countries have pledged to give or sell weapons to Ukraine following the Russian invasion. Ukraine said that more than 350 Ukrainians, including 14 children, have been killed in the conflict so far.

344.title: Can send 4 aircraft a day, each bringing 200 people from Ukraine: IAF
344.article_body: The Indian Air Force on Wednesday said that it can send four aircraft in a day to evacuate Indians stuck in Ukraine. "200 people will be brought back in one round," Vice Chief of Air Staff Sandeep Singh said. "Three IAF aircraft have been sent since morning to evacuate Indians. Relief materials are also being sent," he added.

345.title: Have readied SpaceX Starlink dish for emergency: Ukrainian engineer
345.article_body: A Ukrainian engineer, Oleg Kutkov, said he has readied his SpaceX Starlink dish for emergency use in case regular broadband services are cut amid war. "It's possible that...local internet infrastructure will be destroyed. This would be the emergency state," he said.
