Earlier, Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov had shared an image of SpaceX Starlink terminals that arrived in Ukraine.

346.title: RPI(A) wants to contest 39 seats in PCMC elections: Ramdas Athawale
346.article_body: Union Minister and Republican Party of India (A) chief Ramdas Athawale said on Tuesday that his party is keen to contest 39 seats in the upcoming Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) polls. Athawale added that wherever RPI (A) has "strong candidates", party should be given tickets. "Our alliance [with BJP] will once again come to power in Pimpri-Chinchwad," he further said.

347.title: Godman gets 7-yr-jail for kidnapping & locking up Mumbai boy in 2015
347.article_body: A 57-year-old man, who had dressed as a Godman and kidnapped a 13-year-old boy from Mumbai in 2015, was sentenced to seven years imprisonment by a court in Dindoshi. The accused had taken the boy to Varanasi and kept him locked in a room for over four months. The victim was traced after a co-passenger on the train got suspicious.

348.title: Primary school kids arrested in Russia over anti-war signs, claims Opposition politician
348.article_body: Primary school children have been arrested at an anti-war protest in Russia, according to an Opposition politician. Ilya Yashin shared what appeared to be pictures of three children holding 'no to war' placard in the back of a police van. "Nothing out of the ordinary: just kids in paddy wagons behind an anti-war poster. This is Putin's Russia," he tweeted.

349.title: Olympian Stanislav takes up arms to fight Russia, says 'We'll kill every occupant'
349.article_body: Ukraine's Stanislav Mykolayovych Horuna, who bagged a bronze medal in karate at Tokyo Olympics, has taken up arms to fight Russia amid war with Ukraine."We will kill every occupant who invades," he wrote on Instagram. The 33-year-old also asked his followers on Instagram to donate to support the Ukrainian Army.

350.title: Oil price crosses $110 mark, reaches highest level since July 2014
350.article_body: Crude oil price hit its highest level since July 2014 as it rose past the $110/barrel mark on Wednesday as sanctions imposed on Russia continued to mount. Brent crude rose over 5.8% to $111.09/barrel, its highest since July 2014. US West Texas Intermediate jumped nearly 6% to $109.30/barrel, its highest since September 2013.

351.title: I just work and sleep, I last saw my family 3 days ago: Ukraine's President
351.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, when asked about his life amid the Russian invasion, in an interview said, "I work and sleep, that's it." When asked about whether he can see his family and kids, the Ukrainian President said, "No, I can't." He added that he last saw his family three days ago, in the middle of the war.

352.title: Ashneer's wife says 'time to move on', deletes tweets & videos against BharatPe
352.article_body: Ashneer Grover's wife Madhuri Jain, who was recently fired by BharatPe, deleted tweets and videos criticising the activities of the company's top officials. "We stand by each of our statements but it's time for us to move ahead towards positivity and away from...endless media drama," she said. She also deleted an alleged audio clip of BharatPe's Bhavik Koladiya abusing Ashneer.

353.title: This is what 'Russian peace' looks like: Ukraine on video of missile in Kharkiv
353.article_body: The Defence of Ukraine's official Twitter account on Wednesday shared a video of a Russian missile striking the National Police building in Kharkiv. It also tweeted, "This is what 'Russian peace' looks like." This comes a day after a Russian strike on Kyiv's TV tower killed at least five people.

354.title: Only thing lavish is my dreams: Ashneer on BharatPe's 'fraud for lavish lifestyle' allegation
354.article_body: Ashneer Grover on Wednesday reacted to BharatPe's allegation of "fraud to fund a lavish lifestyle", by saying, "The only thing lavish about me is my dreams and ability to achieve them against all odds through hard work and enterprise." He added, "I'd want to learn who among Amarchand, PwC and A&M started doing an audit on 'lavishness' of one's lifestyle?"

355.title: Jason Roy takes indefinite break from cricket after pulling out of IPL 2022
355.article_body: England batter Jason Roy has announced he'll take an indefinite break from cricket to spend time with his family. This comes a day after Roy, who was bought by Gujarat Titans, pulled out of IPL 2022 citing bio bubble fatigue. "Everything going on in the world over the last three years...[has] taken its toll on me," he had said.

356.title: Int'l players should be able to dominate at domestic level: Saba Karim
356.article_body: Referring to the performance of Cheteshwar Pujara, Ajinkya Rahane in the ongoing Ranji Trophy, ex-India cricketer Saba Karim said international level players should be able to dominate at the domestic level. "I'm not seeing it at the moment, and that is a concern," he added. Pujara and Rahane have scored 99 and 185 runs respectively in their two Ranji matches.

357.title: Mark my words, father-son duo will go to jail: Raut on BJP's Kirit, his son Neil
357.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that BJP leader Kirit Somaiya and his son Neil will go to jail for misusing Central agencies. This comes after Mumbai court rejected the anticipatory bail plea of Neil Somaiya in connection with the PMC Bank case. "If no crime committed, why is the father-son duo moving court for anticipatory bail?" Raut questioned.

358.title: 'Today is not my birthday,' tweets Punjab CM after PM Modi, others wish him
358.article_body: Several leaders including PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to extend birthday wishes to Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi on Tuesday. Channi later tweeted a clarification, saying, "Grateful for all the wishes pouring in for me today, however today is not my birthday." PM Modi had wished him "good health and long life".

359.title: Congress, JD(S) leaders will join BJP ahead of 2023 polls: K'taka CM
359.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said that several leaders from Congress and Janata Dal (Secular) are in touch with the BJP and will be joining the party in the days to come ahead of the 2023 polls. Congress will not come to power in Karnataka for 10 more years, state BJP President Nalinkumar Kateel said.

360.title: IFS officer shares video of stranded bear being released into the wild
360.article_body: An Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer, Parveen Kaswan, shared a video of a stranded Himalayan black bear being released into the wild on Twitter. In the video, the bear that appears to be a cub leaps out of the cage and runs towards the forest cover. "Rescue work was successful without any injury to people or animal," Kaswan tweeted.

361.title: Even when I was fat, I had work: Richa Chadha on body transformation
361.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha revealed that even before her physical transformation, she didn't find it difficult to find work. She said that even when she was fat, she had work. "And now that I'm thin, I want to tell actors, aspiring actors...that you don't have to be a certain shape to continue to get work in the film industry," she added.

362.title: Two kids injured as ceiling of a govt school building collapses in TN
362.article_body: A portion of a ceiling at a government school in Tamil Nadu's Ramanathapuram collapsed injuring two kids aged eight and 10 on Tuesday. The district collector said six kids were playing inside the old school building whose demolition was under process when a wooden beam from the ceiling fell down. The two injured students were rushed to a government hospital.

363.title: Teams of teachers set up to visit homes of students back in Delhi from Ukraine
363.article_body: Two teams of teachers have been set up to be in touch with students who have returned to Delhi from Ukraine. Teams have been directed to visit homes of students who have returned from Ukraine after February 22 and "ensure all necessary steps are being taken for the welfare of students" and also visit families of students stuck in Ukraine.

364.title: Ukrainians line up at gun shops to buy rifles, shotguns amid Russian attack
364.article_body: Ukrainians are reportedly lining up at gun shops to buy rifles and shotguns amid attack by Russian forces. They are also getting trained in how to use the weapons inside the stores. Lviv police have simplified the procedure to buy weapons. The process which used to take two-three weeks can now be finished in two-three days, said a civilian.

365.title: Received India's request to evacuate Indians in Ukraine via Russian territory: Russia
365.article_body: Russian Ambassador-designate to India, Denis Alipov, has said, "We are in touch with the Indian authorities for Indians stranded in Kharkiv, and other areas of eastern Ukraine." "We have received India's request for emergency evacuation of all those stuck there via Russian territory," he further said. "India understands the depth of this crisis," he added.

366.title: BMC forms team to ensure early activation of centre for kids with special needs
366.article_body: The BMC has formed a task force for monitoring its recently announced facility to set up the first early intervention and rehabilitation centre for children with special needs. The task force will work towards early activation of the facility, an official said. The centre will provide medical facilities and therapies to children with any physical and mental disabilities.

367.title: Smriti Irani welcomes Indians evacuated from Ukraine in 4 regional languages
367.article_body: Union minister Smriti Irani on Wednesday welcomed Indians, who were evacuated from war-hit Ukraine under the Centre's Operation Ganga, in four different languages. In a video shared by her on Twitter, Irani was seen speaking in Malayalam, Bengali, Gujarati and Marathi aboard an IndiGo flight. She later said, "Welcome back home! We are grateful that our prayers have been heard."

368.title: I'm hoping he'll write a role for me: Upasana refutes rumours of rift with Kapil
368.article_body: Actress Upasana Singh refused rumours of a rift between her and comedian-actor Kapil Sharma. Upasana revealed she quit 'Comedy Nights With Kapil', which aired on Colors, because of commitment issues and not because she wasn't happy working with him. "Kapil and I...regularly communicate with each other. I'm hoping that he'll someday write a role for me," she added.

369.title: Fire breaks out at factory in Delhi's Narela, 4 fire engines rushed to spot
369.article_body: A fire broke out at a factory in north Delhi's Narela Industrial Area on Wednesday, police said. Police received the information at about 11:03 am, following which four fire tenders were rushed to the spot. According to a senior police official, no person was reported to be inside the factory during the incident.

370.title: Russian forces destroy a maternity home in Ukrainian city, video surfaces
370.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs shared a video of Russian forces destroying a maternity home in Zhytomyr. "If it is not a genocide, what is that?" the ministry wrote. Two people reportedly died at the maternity home in the attack. The Russian invasion of Ukraine entered its seventh day on Wednesday.

371.title: Man lures 4-year-old girl with candies, rapes her in UP; arrested
371.article_body: A four-year-old girl was allegedly raped in Uttar Pradesh by a man who frequently visited her house. The man had come to the girl's house on Monday. He lured her to come to his place by offering her candies and then raped her. The girl was found semi-conscious with injuries on her private parts.

372.title: Russia planning to spread fake news about Ukrainian surrender: Ukraine
372.article_body: Ukrainian Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov on Tuesday said that the country believes Russia is preparing a mass disinformation campaign to suggest senior military and political figures have surrendered. "To 'confirm' this fake information, seemingly signed 'documents', as well as fake, edited videos will be distributed," he further said in an online statement.

373.title: Google blocks Russia media firms RT, Sputnik on app store in Europe
373.article_body: Google has announced that it has blocked mobile apps related to Russian state-run media firms RT and Sputnik from its app store in Europe. RT Deputy Editor-in-Chief Anna Belkina said the outlet's distribution has been cut by technology companies without giving any evidence that it reported falsehoods. YouTube channels connected to RT and Sputnik were also blocked across Europe earlier.

374.title: Won't allow deplorable conduct of Grover family to tarnish our reputation: BharatPe
374.article_body: While removing Ashneer Grover as an employee, founder and director, BharatPe said in a statement, "The board will not allow the deplorable conduct of the Grover family to tarnish BharatPe's reputation." The company alleged that his family engaged in "misappropriation of funds" and Ashneer submitted his resignation ahead of the board's plan to table the report on the governance review.

375.title: Grover family used company's money to fund their lavish lifestyles: BharatPe
375.article_body: BharatPe on Wednesday alleged that Ashneer Grover and family "grossly abused" company expense accounts to "enrich themselves and fund their lavish lifestyles". The Grover family created "fake vendors through which they siphoned money away from the company's account", it said in a statement. BharatPe removed Ashneer as a founder, a day after he resigned as MD and director.

376.title: Russia claims taking full control of Ukraine's Kherson
376.article_body: The Russian Ministry of Defence has claimed that its troops have taken full control of southern Ukrainian city of Kherson. Russian military command is in talks with the Kherson municipality and other municipal departments, the ministry added. The Russia-Ukraine war entered its seventh day today. Heavy shelling was reported in Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv as well.

377.title: 6,000 Indians brought back to India from Ukraine till Tuesday: V Muraleedharan
377.article_body: Around 20,000 Indians were stuck in Ukraine and over 6,000 of them have been brought back till Tuesday, MoS MEA, V Muraleedharan, said on Wednesday. "Around 20,000 Indians were stuck in Ukraine. Of these, 4,000 people returned by 24th February. Till yesterday, over 2,000 more people have returned," Muraleedharan added.

378.title: Anti-vaccine protesters clash with police outside New Zealand Parliament
378.article_body: A clash broke out between anti-COVID vaccine mandate protesters and the police outside the Parliament in New Zealand's Wellington on Wednesday. The agitators reportedly set several tents on fire creating thick clouds of smoke in the air. The police used pepper spray on some of the protesters and started towing vehicles blocking the streets in the area.

379.title: 2 men arrested after police bust sex racket in Pune
379.article_body: The Pune City Police have arrested a 20-year-old man and a 26-year-old man from Jharkhand for allegedly operating a sex racket. The accused, Jayshankar Sav and Kuldip Mahto, were allegedly trafficking women from other states to Pune for flesh trade. Acting on a tip-off, police reportedly laid a trap at a hotel and arrested the alleged sex racketeers on Monday.

380.title: I used to plan my wicket celebrations, now I focus on making team win: Bumrah
380.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has said that when he was a youngster he used to get "overexcited" and "plan his celebrations" after taking wickets. "[Now], I try to focus on the job at hand...When the team has won...there's ample time to celebrate...my focus is on making the team win," he added. Bumrah has been named vice-captain for Sri Lanka Tests.

381.title: Appalled but not surprised: Ashneer Grover on BharatPe's allegations of fraud
381.article_body: Ashneer Grover on Wednesday said he is appalled by BharatPe's allegations of fraud and financial misdoing for a "lavish lifestyle" after the company said he's no longer an employee, founder or director. "I am appalled at the personal nature of the company's statement, but not surprised," said Ashneer. "The only thing lavish about me is my dreams," he added.

382.title: Not mandatory to seek resignation of any minister until crime proven: Jayant Patil
382.article_body: Maharashtra minister Jayant Patil said it's not mandatory to seek the resignation of any minister until the crime is proven. His statement comes as NCP's Nawab Malik has been arrested by the ED in connection with a money laundering case. "If everyday some kind of action is being taken against ministers, it isn't mandatory to seek their resignation," Patil added.

383.title: Australia’s wildfires caused a 1% loss in ozone, finds study
383.article_body: The 2019-2020 Australian bushfires resulted in depletion of the ozone layer, a study has found. As per the study, smoke that rose into the atmosphere due to these wildfires resulted in a 1% loss of ozone, an amount that usually takes 10 years to recover. Scientists have warned rising wildfires due to climate change may slow down ozone recovery further.

384.title: 2 men rape woman on pretext of curing her of black magic in Palghar
384.article_body: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly raped by two men on pretext of curing her of black magic in Palghar last week. The woman alleged that the accused said she was facing problems because of a black magic spell cast on her and claimed they would perform magic tricks to cure her sufferings. When she followed their instructions, they raped her.

385.title: HC to issue directions on pleas seeking removal of marital rape exception
385.article_body: Delhi High Court has said that it will issue directions on March 2 on the batch of pleas seeking criminalisation of marital rape and reserved its verdict in the case. The petitions filed challenged the exception to Section 375, which exempts forced sexual intercourse by a man with his wife, from the criminal offence of rape.

386.title: I exploded on set, all actors became quiet: Bhansali on 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'
386.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said that he once "exploded" on the set of 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' because he "wanted a certain atmosphere". "All the actors...became quiet. It was my way of giving those vibes to her [Alia]...Till date she doesn't know that this is what I did to get her into that space," he added.

387.title: Ukraine forces kill team of assassins who were plotting to murder President Zelenskyy
387.article_body: Head of Ukraine's National Security and Defense Council Oleksiy Danilov announced on television that a unit of Chechen assassins sent on a mission to murder Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has been "eliminated". "I can say that we received information from representatives of FSB (Russia's Federal Security Service) who have no desire to take part in this bloody war," Danilov added.

388.title: 2 men convicted for placing fence on railway tracks in Mumbai
388.article_body: A Mumbai court convicted two men in their thirties for placing a fence on railway tracks thus endangering lives. The accused had allegedly placed the fence between the Marine Lines and Charni Road railway stations in 2018. However, since they were arrested soon after the act, the court sentenced them to the period they had already undergone in custody.

389.title: 1 mn COVID vaccines expire in Guatemala as people refuse to take shot
389.article_body: Guatemala health authorities said over a million doses of Russia's Sputnik COVID-19 vaccine have expired because nobody was willing to take the shot. "We've tried to make available all the vaccines of different brands...Unfortunately, there has been a rejection among the public to vaccination," Health Minister Francisco Coma said, adding that the wasted shots cost the government about $11 million.

390.title: China conducts genocide, what more does Apple need to act: Meta ex-exec
390.article_body: Former Meta executive Alex Stamos in response to Apple's actions against Russia said, "The PRC [China] is conducting a genocide domestically; what more does Apple need to act?" "Apple has done more for...PRC than any other US tech company has done for any other authoritarian state," he added. Stamos said Apple prevents Chinese dissidents from installing secure messengers and VPNs.

391.title: Groundwater in rural areas in 31 Bihar districts contaminated: Economic Survey
391.article_body: Groundwater in rural areas in 31 out of 38 districts in Bihar is affected by arsenic, fluoride and iron contamination, state Economic Survey, 2021-2022, has revealed. "A total of 4,742 rural wards in 14 districts situated along the Ganga are...affected by arsenic contamination," the report added. The survey referred to the findings of the Public Health Engineering Department (PHED).

392.title: US First Lady Jill wears blue dress with sunflower in support of Ukraine
392.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden wore a blue dress featuring an embroidered sunflower on the sleeve as a tribute to Ukraine amid Russia's invasion. Blue is one of the colours of the Ukrainian flag, while the sunflower is the national flower of the country. Earlier, a video showing a Ukrainian woman giving sunflower seeds to Russian soldier went viral.

393.title: Putin's closest friend Abramovich is panicking, wants to sell Chelsea: Swiss billionaire
393.article_body: Calling Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich one of Vladimir Putin's closest advisers and friends, Swiss billionaire Hansjorg Wyss said Abramovich is panicking like all other Russian oligarchs. "He's trying to sell all his properties in England. He also wants to get rid of Chelsea quickly," added Wyss. Wyss also said he has received an offer to buy the club from Abramovich.

394.title: Siblings on way to school hit by car with juvenile driver in Chandigarh
394.article_body: Two siblings, 17-year-old Jyoti and 15-year-old Suraj, were hit by a car being driven by a juvenile in Chandigarh's Mani Majra area on Tuesday. Jyoti suffered a fracture in one of her arms while Suraj received multiple injuries. The incident took place when the siblings were going to school. Police have started legal proceedings against the father of the driver.

395.title: Ashneer no longer a founder, his family engaged in misappropriation of funds: BharatPe
395.article_body: A day after BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover resigned as MD, BharatPe said in a statement on Wednesday that he is "no longer an employee, a founder, or a director of the company". BharatPe also alleged that Ashneer's "family and their relatives engaged in extensive misappropriation of company funds" and board reserves the right to take further legal action against him.

396.title: Husband had hernia surgery; he couldn't lift daughter for 2 months: Shriya
396.article_body: Actress Shriya Saran revealed her husband Andrei Koscheev had hernia surgery. Taking to Instagram, Shriya said that Andrei couldn't lift their daughter Radha for two months. Sharing a few pictures with her husband, Shriya wrote, "Thank you @theapollohospitals...for taking such good care of @andreikoscheev." Shriya also thanked actor Ram Charan's wife Upasana Kamineni Konidela, for helping them.

397.title: Japanese defence veterans volunteer to fight for Ukraine: Report
397.article_body: As many as 70 Japanese, including 50 former members of the country's Self-Defense Forces, have reportedly volunteered to fight for Ukraine against the Russian invasion. Ukraine's Embassy in Japan thanked the Japanese people in a social media post but said, "Any candidates for this must have experience in Japan's Self-Defence Forces or have undergone specialised training."

398.title: Middlesbrough knock out Spurs, Man Utd in consecutive rounds of FA Cup
398.article_body: Middlesbrough FC defeated Tottenham Hotspur 1-0 in their fifth round encounter of the FA Cup following a goal in the second half of extra time by Josh Coburn, having earlier knocked out Manchester United. United crashed out of the FA Cup after a 7-8 defeat on penalties in the fourth round, with Cristiano Ronaldo missing a penalty in the match.

399.title: IPL is the strongest T20 league: Usman Khawaja on IPL vs PSL debate
399.article_body: Sharing his opinion on debate over the better T20 league between IPL and PSL, Australian cricketer Usman Khawaja said IPL is the strongest league in the world adding that there's not really a contest. "They have all the world come to them and it is the only league in the world to have Indian cricketers," stated Khawaja.

400.title: When things are not going for you, people start talking: Harmanpreet Kaur
400.article_body: India Women ODI vice-captain Harmanpreet Kaur, who last scored an ODI ton in 2017, has said, "When things are not going for you, people start talking." Harmanpreet, however, also added her last two innings have given her a lot of confidence going into the Women's ODI World Cup. She scored a half-century and a century in her last two innings.

401.title: Delhi likely to receive light rainfall today and tomorrow: IMD
401.article_body: Delhi could expect light rainfall today and tomorrow due to western disturbance, the India Meteorological Department forecast showed. The maximum temperature in the national capital on Tuesday was at 26 degrees Celsius, which is likely to touch 28 degrees Celsius on Wednesday, the Met department said. Temperature in Delhi can go upto 30 degrees Celsius-mark by March 7, it added.

402.title: Sensex crashes 1,100 points, Nifty below 16,600 amid Russia-Ukraine war
402.article_body: The Sensex crashed around 1,100 points on Wednesday after crude oil price surged past $110 per barrel amid Russia-Ukraine war and India reported that its GDP growth slowed to 5.4% in Q3. The Sensex was trading below 55,200 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 fell over 270 points to trade below 16,600 levels.

403.title: Boeing suspends maintenance & technical support for Russian airlines
403.article_body: US planemaker Boeing said it's suspending "parts, maintenance and technical support for services for Russian airlines" as well as "major operations in Moscow". "As the [Ukraine-Russia] conflict continues, our teams are focused on ensuring the safety of our teammates in the region," a Boeing spokesperson said. Boeing on Monday had said it'd paused operations at its Moscow Training Campus.
